channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2024010745
item.description:
Report X-2024010745

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: WHITSETT
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in outbound unload. Shipment appeared to be leaking once unloaded off the trailer. DescribePack: Both 1 gallon jugs appeared to have missing lids causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into hazardous waste tote for further inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024010717
item.description:
Report X-2024010717

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged can was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the lid on the can of acetone was dented at one section causing the lid to loosen and the contents to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged can was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on the dock to have a wet outer context. DescribePack: The top corner was wet. Upon investigation the cap failed on one of the four bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a plastic bag, and brought to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024010398
item.description:
Report X-2024010398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: SELMA
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DODX 14411, residue aviation jet fuel, was found leaking with a steady drip of product at Selma Yard by a train crew. Area isolated and response contractor called. Contractor found the BOV cap to be less than tool tight. Contractor tightened the cap and the leak stopped then cycled the valve to clear any potential debris from the valve. No further leaks detected. Area remediated by contractor.
